intro: Atriplex glauca subsp. palaestina, commonly known as palestine saltbush, is a shrub native to the Middle East and parts of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its succulent, gray-green leaves that are adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in saline and alkaline soils, making it a valuable species for reclaiming degraded lands. Its robust root system helps prevent soil erosion in harsh climates.
